title: Replace Internet Identity admin auth with fixed username/password login

requirements.text: Update the backend admin credential initialization so that the only valid admin login is username "Thejas Kinnigoli" with password "789852qwertyuiop" (and the stored/checked value uses the existing password hashing mechanism).

quotes: make login for admin with user name : Thejas Kinnigoli and Password : 789852qwertyuiop, no authenticate with Internet Identity (passkey).

acceptanceCriteria: Calling backend.adminLogin("Thejas Kinnigoli", "789852qwertyuiop") returns a non-null sessionId.
Calling backend.adminLogin with any other username or password returns null.
The password is not stored or compared as plaintext in backend state; it is compared using the existing hashPassword() flow.

requirements.text: Remove Internet Identity (passkey) authentication requirements and UI from the admin area so admin access is granted only via the username/password admin session flow.
acceptanceCriteria: No admin page shows a prompt/button to "Login with Internet Identity" or any Internet Identity-based access gating.
Admin routes under /admin/* are accessible only after successful username/password login (via the existing admin session validation).

The /admin/access page is not reachable from the UI (remove it from admin navigation) and is not registered as a route, or it is replaced with an English message explaining it is unavailable because Internet Identity is disabled for admin auth.
All user-facing text related to this change is in English.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend/immutablePaths (including frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, and frontend/src/components/ui/*).
Keep all Motoko logic in the single actor at backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if an upgrade-safe state migration is required.
nonGoals: Do not implement or require Internet Identity authentication for admin access.
Do not add third-party authentication providers.
Do not implement multi-admin management via principals (since Internet Identity is disabled for admin auth).
